thread.title: New Apple TV Missing Backbone: Content
thread.title_full: New Apple TV Missing Backbone: Content

title: New Apple TV Missing Backbone: Content
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
9 Sep 2015 01:17 AM EST 
Apple’s CEO is about to unveil a long-awaited new version of Apple TV at a press event in San Francisco on September 8. the new apple tv has beefier hardware, a fancy new remote control, more apps and a new focus on video games. But one essential feature will be missing from Tim Cook's keynote: the company’s very own video service.Apple has been working for some time on a cable killer, and is looking to combine broadcast and select cable networks for a cheaper, better-looking bundle. The company has even talked to execs in Hollywood about producing its own original programming.But no Apple originals are in the near future, and negotiations with networks to license channels have been slow-moving.
